intro: Phyllorkis cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heathers. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
